qas.question: Who decides if Muslims attend secular schools or traditional madaris?
What are madaris referred to as in Indonesia and Malaysia?
What region of the Philippines has a large Muslim population?
What region of Thailand has madaris?
Who decides if non-Muslims attend secular schools or traditional madaris?
What are madaris referred to as outside of Indonesia and Malaysia?
What region of the Philippines has a large non-Muslim population?
What region of Thailand does not have madaris?

context: In Southeast Asia, Muslim <a0_0><b4_0>students<b4_0/><a0_0/> have a choice of attending a secular government or an Islamic school. Madaris or Islamic schools are known as <a1_0><b5_0>Sekolah Agama<b5_0/><a1_0/> (Malay: religious school) in Malaysia and Indonesia, โรงเรียนศาสนาอิสลาม (Thai: school of Islam) in Thailand and madaris in the Philippines. In countries where Islam is not the majority or state religion, Islamic schools are found in regions such as <a3_0><b7_0>southern<b7_0/><a3_0/> Thailand (near the Thai-Malaysian border) and the southern Philippines in <a2_0><b6_0>Mindanao<b6_0/><a2_0/>, where a significant Muslim population can be found.
